plants.name: Rhododendron spp.
plants.description: Rhododendrons are woody plants with large, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in dense clusters. They prefer acidic soils and are popular in temperate gardens worldwide.
plants.location: Northern Hemisphere temperate zones (e.g., North America, Europe, Asia)
plants.funFact: Rhododendrons are known for their stunning spring blooms and some species are evergreen, providing year-round foliage.

plants.name: Tropaeolum majus
plants.description: Nasturtiums are low-growing annual plants with round leaves and vibrant, trumpet-shaped flowers. They are edible and often used in salads for their peppery taste.
plants.location: Native to South America, widely cultivated globally
plants.funFact: Nasturtiums attract pollinators like bees and hummingbirds, making them great companion plants in gardens.

plants.name: Acacia pycnantha
plants.description: Golden Wattle is a small tree or shrub with fragrant yellow flowers arranged in fluffy spherical clusters. It is the floral emblem of Australia and blooms in late winter to spring.
plants.bloomingSeason: August to November in Australia (Southern Hemisphere) but can bloom early in mild climates around May
plants.funFact: The Golden Wattle's bright yellow flowers are a symbol of unity and resilience in Australia.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: Delphiniums are tall, perennial plants with spiked inflorescences of two-lipped flowers. They thrive in cooler temperate climates and are favored in cottage gardens.
plants.location: Temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere
plants.funFact: Delphiniums are toxic if ingested but are beloved for their vibrant flower spikes that can reach up to 2 meters tall.
